Es una pasada este juego, acciÃ³n directa sin complicaciones, con una buena comunidad y una cantidad absurda de mapas. Las armas son muy gratas de usar y tienes bastante variedad de ellas. AdemÃ¡s el sistema de clases te cambia tanto la forma de jugar que puedes echarle bastantes horas. Recomendado jugar con colegas para pasartelo mejor.

An absolute delight of a challenge to play through on your own. This game slams you down on your head, bounces you back up like a ball and just in the knick of time uppercuts you and shatters your teeth. This game is NOT for everyone, but those seeking a great challenge are welcome.

lindo juego funciona en mi tostadora

I remember playing this game back when I enjoyed life, back when the "normal music" was good, back when I wasn't struggling through life, back when I had something I could obtain in the future, now I have nothing because my life was taken from me at a pre-mature age.  I would do anything to go back to 2011 when I was 13, and the only thing that mattered was killing some zombies in a video game, back when I was actually happy and not struggling each day to keep the thoughts out of my head of doing horrendous things to the ones who wrongfully took my life from me, for I am in a war with myself and I must fight it every single day..

                Nobody Will Ever Understand My Pain.
                                           So I Must Fight For My Life Alone..
                            For My Happiness To Which I Deserve...

Pros:
-has a nice web server interface for interacting with your multiplayer server
-can be genuinely challenging
-decent gore physics
-some scenarios are quite scary (depends on the player's personality)
-decent selection of different weapons
Cons:
-repetitive game play
-small, confined maps
-annoying slow motion effects
-the characters have almost zero personality e.g. The trader always says the same things every time you meet her.
-has no story
-the game has not aged well
Verdict:
While there are some redeeming qualities, this is a worse version of L4D. Either get L4D or buy Killing Floor 2.

This game was shown to me around 2008 by one of the guys I deployed with.  "You have to try this game, it's cheap on Steam right now.  You get to play as a British accented guy and you blow away these crazy looking specimens!"  Zombies? "No, not quite.  You have to see for yourself."

So I did, and I loved it.  Wave after wave of intense fighting, you earn money to buy weapons for special classes that you can play with your group.  Sharpshooter, Commando, Beserker, Field Medic (which quickly became my favorite), and so on.

There's definitely comic relief, I love the comments made by the characters you play.  Especially when you need help (you are dying), reloading, dropping items or money, and the simple taunting of other players and specimens.  I absolutely love it.

And then at the end, you get to fight a small wave of specimens, and then the boss that has a few different abilities.  Don't go toe to toe with this guy, you'll probably eat the end of his minigun strapped to his arm, or you'll get munched on.  

It's a fun shooter! Killing Floor 2 is also very good, it's the same game just with an updated graphics engine and whatnot.  I'd play this one first, and see if you like Killing Floor.  I bought Killing Floor 1 and when Killing Floor 2 came out, I didn't hesitate to buy it.

This game brought together two things i love; light-hearted humor and high skill ceilings. Not to mention being so accessible and low spec that it's got a fair shot at running on your smart fridge.

This is one of the games that got me into PC gaming in the first place, if that's anything to write home about!
